column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////Came here on a Thursday afternoon around 2pm to try some Chicago pizza since I'm not from the area. Luckily the wait wasn't bad when we came
column2: and we were seated after 5 minutes. However
column3: their pizzas do take roughly 45 minutes to make
column4: so even if you are seated immediately
column5: you will still have a bit of a wait. At times when there is no immediate seating available
column6: they let you pre-order your pizza so that you'll have less of a wait once you are seated.
